intro: Euphoriopsis longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved euphoriopsis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with distinctive cyathium inflorescences. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
